definition[0]: directly under another object or covered by it
example[0]: He got out of the car and looked underneath.
example[1]: It’s near where the railway goes underneath the road.
example[2]: She was wearing a smart jacket with a T-shirt underneath.
example[3]: Her blonde hair was hidden underneath a baseball cap.
definition[1]: on the lower surface of something
example[5]: A number had been painted underneath the table.
definition[2]: used to say what someone’s character is really like when their behaviour shows a different character
example[6]: She seems confident, but she’s really quite shy underneath.
example[7]: I think he’s a genuinely nice guy underneath it all.
